metadata.title: CVE-2016-1688 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The regexp (aka regular expression) implementation in Google V8 before5.0.71.40, as used in Google Chrome before 51.0.2704.63, mishandlesexternal string sizes, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds read) via crafted JavaScript code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1688` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu2~cm1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
